sentences.english: Additionally, the defendant may file a counter - claim (or cross- claim) to assert the defendant's own claims against the plaintiff.
sentences.chinese: 另外，被告可以遞交反訴狀來向原告主張自己的權利。

sentences.english: The complaint contains a copy of the ‘449 Patent.
sentences.chinese: 該訴狀包含了一份“449專利”的副本。

sentences.english: An indictment or information is presented to the court, and a formal arraignment on the charges is held.
sentences.chinese: 起訴方向法院提供起訴狀，根據控訴正式傳訊被告。

sentences.english: Victims of these injuries took Ford to court to sue.
sentences.chinese: 受害者一紙訴狀將福特告上了法庭。

sentences.english: Later, company of Jiang Xuanting of one paper indictment told Mr Li court.
sentences.chinese: 之後，李先生一紙訴狀將玄霆公司告上了法庭。
刑事訴狀的措辭不正確。

sentences.english: Their lawsuit argues that Citizens should have provided them with digital tokens.
sentences.chinese: 他們在訴狀中稱，國民銀行早該向他們提供數字密鑰。

sentences.english: Zhang Leyi thinks in petition for appeal, court of first instance adjudicates misgivings.
sentences.chinese: 張樂奕在上訴狀中認爲，一審法院判決不妥。

sentences.english: Toshiba said that it had not received a complaint so could not comment.
sentences.chinese: 東芝表示，尚未接到訴狀，因此不便置評。

sentences.english: The clerk was gabbing over the indictment .
sentences.chinese: 書記官在喃喃誦讀起訴狀。

sentences.english: I put the transparent document bag with counterclaim in it on the table intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 故意將裝有反訴狀的透明文件袋放在桌上。

sentences.english: Article 148 When filing an appeal, a motion of appeal shall be submitted.
sentences.chinese: 第一百四十八條上訴應當遞交上訴狀。

sentences.english: In basic law classes, the teacher taught us how to write an administrative statement of claim.
sentences.chinese: 法律基礎課上，老師教了我們行政起訴狀的寫法。

sentences.english: The justices get thousands of petitions every year, asking them to hear cases.
sentences.chinese: 每年法官都會接到數千份訴狀，希望他們能審理案件。

sentences.english: She has lodged a complaint with the police.
sentences.chinese: 她已經向警察局呈遞了訴狀。

sentences.english: Petition for bail from accused witches, ca. 1692.
sentences.chinese: 被控指邪術之保釋人訴狀。

definition: common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
